formattedAddress: 142 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 142 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: A unique menu with some things you won't see anywhere else. Try the canap√©s starter which provides a taste of small bites varying from meat to fish and all delicious. Service is top notch. Our waiter Declan was superb with excellent knowledge of the wines and a friendly yet professional demeanor. The dessert of chocolate chip cookie dough casserole was delicious. The decor is a bit generic but the food and service make it worth a try. Be aware that they don't have a liquor license so only wine and wine based cocktails.

originalText.text: I went to a small group dinner here last night and woke up dreaming about some of the dishes I tried here. The menu is seasonal but it it‚Äôs on menu when you go (and you must go) please order the Brussels salad, the lobster pasta, the sea bass (I‚Äôm saying ohhh my aloud right now thinking about the sauce!) and ALL of the desserts. No words for the butter candle. Just gold. Drooling right now. The location is amazing, and it‚Äôs super spacious considering the location (tables aren‚Äôt on top of each other, you have space to walk through and sit at the bar if you‚Äôd like). The staff were helpful with suggestions and talking us through the menu and the chefs were incredible!

originalText.text:
Visited NYC for the Jets/Dolphins game on Black Friday and our group of 8 ventured over to Carriage House for a wonderful experience.
The bar when you enter is gorgeous and looks like a wonderful spot to grab a weeknight meal and have a couple drinks (can't wait for them to get liquor license) We started our meal with some cocktails they made from wine or sake and I have to say they were excellent! The margarita was a real standout to me.

We ordered several apps and shared our entree's family style so everyone could try a few things. The butter candle and bread was just outstanding, the bread was reminiscent of a Hawaiian roll, delish! We had the small bites (forgot the fancy name) but the scallop and wagyu were awesome! The brussel salad was outstanding, the burrata with dragon fruit was incredible! Prob the best burrata dish I have ever had.

The entree's came and we loved the short rib dish, the agnolotti pasta with oxtail filling was just absurdly good, especially on a cool Nov evening. The lobster pasta was also a star, the sauce was DeVine!

Deserts came next, at this point I was so full I could not fully enjoy them but I tasted a couple and can certainly say they were up to snuff. It was a while back and I don't have pictures to remind me but I do recall a cookie like desert that was really fun and tasty.

Go and check this place out, its fun and a great vibe!

originalText.text:
The food was incredible.

The pumpkin butter with pepita crust is a must.

The burrata literally was like you were eating French onion soup - around the cheese there was the crispy onion and this jus sauce. It was incredible.

Then the burger - that truly went in our top 5 burgers.. it was so good and the sauce on it was üëåüèª

Then the lobster pasta with crunchy toppings.. I have been dreaming about the food since we ate it üòÇ

originalText.text: Excellent brunch! Food menu is unique and delicious, and the service was fantastic. We loved everything we had, including the cocktails/drinks. Zach was super helpful with menu selection, and was an all around outstanding server. All the staff was very friendly and help welcoming. We will be back!
